src:
Liga Champions: Barcelona Soroti Ketangguhan Slavia Praha
05 Nov 2019, 04:11 by Terjemahan, Aditya Budiman
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Barcelona akan menyambut kedatangan Slavia Praha di Stadion Camp Nou dalam lanjutan Liga Champions. Kedua tim dijadwalkan bertemu pada Rabu dini hari, 6 November 2019 waktu Indonesia.
Kekalahan Lionel Messi dan kawan-kawan dari Levante di Liga Spanyol menjadi sinyal peringatan bagi pelatih Barcelona, Ernesto Valverde. Hasil negatif itu memutus empat kemenangan beruntun Barcelona di lima laga terakhir.
Valverde tak menutupi bila penampilan tim tidak bagus saat bermain di markas Levante. Namun ia optimistis para pemain sudah melupakan kekalahan 1-3 dari Levante dan mengincar tiga poin saat meladeni Slavia Praha. "Kami akan kembali ke jalur kemenangan," kata dia, Selasa, 5 November 2019.
Barcelona belum terkalah di fase Grup F Liga Champions. Dari dua laga, Barca meraih dua kemenangan dan sekali seri. Salah satu kemenangan juara Liga Spanyol ini diraih ketika bertandang ke Slavia.
Di laga itu Messi mencetak gol yang kemudian dibalas oleh Jan Boril. Kemenangan Barcelona ditentukan oleh gol bunuh diri yang dikemas oleh Peter Olayinka.
Valverde memprediksi di laga nanti lawan tidak akan mengubah gaya permainan. Ia mengatakan Slavia amat mengandalkan kekuatan fisik pada pemainnya. "Mereka setia dengan gaya khas-nya. Slavia bisa lebih berbahaya saat bermain di luar kandang," sebut dia.
Di klasemen Grup F Liga Champions, Barcelona berada di puncak dengan tujuh poin. Tempat kedua dan ketiga diisi oleh Borussia Dortmund dan Inter Milan yang sama-sama mengemas empat angka. Sementara Slavia baru meraih satu poin dan menjadi juru kunci grup.

UEFA
text:
Champions League: Barcelona Highlight the Slavic Resilience of Prague
05 Nov 2019, 04:11 by Translation, Aditya Budiman
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Barcelona will welcome Slavia Prague at the Camp Nou Stadium in the Champions League. The two teams are scheduled to meet early Wednesday, 6 November 2019 Indonesian time.
The defeat of Lionel Messi and his friends from Levante in the Spanish League is a warning signal for Barcelona coach, Ernesto Valverde. The negative result was cut off four successive Barcelona wins in the last five matches.
Valverde did not cover if the team's performance was not good when playing at Levante's headquarters. But he is optimistic the players have forgotten 1-3 defeat of Levante and eyeing three points when serving Slavia Prague. "We will get back to winning ways," he said, Tuesday, November 5, 2019.
Barcelona has not lost in the Champions League Group F phase. Of the two matches, Barca won two wins and one draw. One of the victories of the Spanish league champions was achieved when they travel to Slavia.
In that match Messi scored a goal which was then returned by Jan Boril. Barcelona's victory is determined by an own goal set by Peter Olayinka.
Valverde predicts that in the game the opponent will not change the style of play. He said Slavs relied heavily on physical strength on their players. "They are loyal to his distinctive style. Slavs can be more dangerous when playing outside the cage," he said.
In the Champions League Group F standings, Barcelona are top with seven points. The second and third places were filled by Borussia Dortmund and Inter Milan who both packed four points. While Slavia only won one point and became the caretaker of the group.

UEFA
